subject: Re: [junit] junit and different jvms
msgSnippet: ... JUnit is just a Java library and application.  It does nothing special with the JVM. Can you explain the errors you are seeing? -- Jason Rogers I am
messageBody:
soham_ssg wrote:

> i have a strange problem.
>
> when i run my test suite with oracle's jvm, it works fine. but with
> hotspot, some of the test cases fail.
>
> can anyone plz explain how junit is integrated with different jvms???

JUnit is just a Java library and application. It does nothing special
with the JVM.

Can you explain the errors you are seeing?

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
